alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Howard; Phelps; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 15 at 12:54PM CDT until March 15 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning remains in effect from 1 PM this afternoon through 8 PM this evening... .Increasing winds...gusting to near 25 MPH...combined with low relative humidity values...will result in critical fire weather conditions for areas primarily along and northwest of a line extending from Beaver City...to Grand Island...to Greeley Nebraska today. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 039, 040, 046, 047, 060, 061, 062, 072, 073 AND 082... * AFFECTED AREA...In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 039 Valley, Fire Weather Zone 040 Greeley, Fire Weather Zone 046 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 047 Howard, Fire Weather Zone 060 Dawson, Fire Weather Zone 061 Buffalo, Fire Weather Zone 062 Hall, Fire Weather Zone 072 Gosper, Fire Weather Zone 073 Phelps and Fire Weather Zone 082 Furnas. * WINDS...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * TIMING...1 to 8 PM CDT Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 17 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could lead to fire ignition.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Greeley; Hall; Howard; Phelps; Sherman; Valley
